editorialNotes.standard: The infection has begun and it’s up to you to strategically spread and evolve a deadly plague to bring about the end of the human race. Saving the world and being a hero is honourable, but decimating the world with a deadly infection is a whole lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

editorialNotes.tagline: Plan a new metro in Chongqing
editorialNotes.standard: Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains and upgrading lines. There’s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing underground lines come together—and since no two games play alike, we’re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: The realm is yours to rule
Build your own city as mayor!

editorialNotes.tagline: From the creator of Plague Inc.

editorialNotes.standard: The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Don’t be fooled by the cute visuals and quirky dialogue. Beneath the charming sheen, Warbits is a deceptively complex strategy game. As you make your way through a campaign packed with turn-based battles, you’re forced to make tough decisions. Do you try to stealthily capture an enemy base or wage a full-on assault and put your strongest units at risk? With a challenging campaign and several multiplayer game types (including a same-screen local mode!), your tactics will be put to the test.
editorialNotes.short: Devise complex strategies to come out on top.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We love dropping into this city builder’s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighbourhoods of our own creation.
Form smart alliances to keep the spice flowing in this superb digital re-imagining of the popular board game.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: How do you build a kingdom? By galloping around and flinging gold at people, then seeing how they help you. That’s the great thing about this deceptively deep survival game—how amazing you feel when you figure out everything from securing laborers to mounting defenses against monsters. And finding all the secrets (like a unicorn that drops gold) will keep you busy for ages.
editorialNotes.short: Charge into this captivating struggle to survive in hostile territory.

editorialNotes.standard: A fascinating reinvention of a longtime videogame franchise, Hitman GO takes familiar elements of stealth and assassination and reinterprets them as a wondrously stylised, turn-based boardgame. Each mission presents characters and scenes—some from previous Hitman games—as a sleek diorama, blending old and new to create an innovative experience. Even with helpful distractions and places to hide, inching toward your targets a step at a time demands keen strategy, and trying to pull off optional mission objectives quickly becomes an irresistible obsession.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: This is not relaxing. This is not simple. But it is so, so good.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Klei’s knack for building immersive worlds pays off big-time in Invisible, Inc. The techno-future vibe grabbed us from the get-go, and the hours whizzed by as we infiltrated corporations with our team of super-spies. A brilliant stealth game, its open-ended missions let you hack secrets, avoid detection, and use slick gadgets however you like.

If you’re going to wage Total War, you better have a total strategy. Feral’s faithful port takes us right back to the amazingly complex battles of Rome. We can’t help but make alliances, purposely break them, then chase down our newfound enemies. It’s all fun and games, right? That is, until they get the upper hand…

name: A Game of Thrones: Board Game

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Maybe the coolest thing about Crowntakers is how much it feels like a pen-and-paper RPG. From forming a party to saving the king, its mix of exploration and tactical combat is only missing a handful of funky dice. We love the way no two adventures play the same, and how every corner of its world is full of humorous moments.
editorialNotes.short: An amazing genre mashup that will test your tactics.
